summary: The Public Buildings Reform Board was created in 2016 to help dispose of unneeded federal real property (primarily land and buildings). The Board identified 44 properties and recommended 12 for disposal in 2019. The Office of Management and Budget approved these properties for disposal in January 2020. However, we found that the Board did not fully document the process it used to evaluate these properties...
title: Federal Real Property: Additional Documentation of Decision Making Could Improve Transparency of New Disposal Process
